availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Edwin "Ed" McGary (Hopkins County, Ky, wagoner and teamster 3rd Ky Mtd Inf (csa))

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, wagoner and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Toliver McGary and Varinda Young McGary. Student in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Wagoner in Hopkins County in 1860. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as private and teamster from August 19, 1861 to 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 89A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 831.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #12394.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0093.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 100-01.
